job_description:
About SureSwift Capital

You made it. You found the dream job you’re looking for where people and culture come first. If that’s as important to you as it is to us then please keep reading.

SureSwift places a high emphasis on a positive work-life balance. Work from anywhere, in the schedule that best suits you. We only require you to be online in meetings hours, which are just a few per week.

We value creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and are committed to building a culture where everyone thrives! SureSwift Capital is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are looking to fill this role in our Canadian market.

About Back In Stock

Back in Stock is a monolithic Ruby on Rails application that follows the principles of Rails: simplicity, convention over configuration, RESTful design. It delivers millions of notifications daily through Sidekiq.

Your Work

You will work closely with other talented and experienced developers in an environment that prioritizes learning and pragmatism. You’ll also be working with the product manager, customer happiness, marketing, and UX design teams.

Once you get settled in, your day to day activities will look something like this:

Plan and implement high quality code in an agile environment
Develop new features
Identify bugs and bottlenecks, propose and implement solutions
Assist customer support teams with escalated tickets
Contribute ideas to improve the product

Your Skills

8+ years of professional experience with Ruby on Rails
Proficiency in English language, both written and verbal
Strong knowledge of SQL, particularly PostgreSQL
Strong HTML, CSS, and Javascript skills
Familiar with Sidekiq
Strong sense of ownership
Self-motivated and self-managing
Experience working with remote teams
Experience working with high-volume systems is desirable, as our app delivers millions of notifications monthly.

Your Compensation

The annual pay range for this role is expected to be up to $120,000 CAD. Actual base pay could vary based on factors including but not limited to experience, subject matter expertise, geographic location where work will be performed and the applicant’s skill set.

Background checks will be conducted on final candidates.

Thanks for the time you took to read about this opportunity.

*If selected for the interview phase, candidates will be asked to show code that they have developed and describe it. If they do not have any available to show, the interviewer will show a code example and ask the candidate about what could be improved.*
